description: Write a function that checks if a file path contains '..' (parent directory reference). Return true if '..' is found, false otherwise. Must handle empty input safely. Example (Found): pathContainsDotDot("../etc/passwd") -> true. Example (Not Found): pathContainsDotDot("/home/user/file.txt") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a path is absolute (starts with '/' on Unix or drive letter on Windows). Return true if absolute, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Absolute): isAbsolutePath("/home/user") -> true. Example (Relative): isAbsolutePath("../file.txt") -> false.

Write a function that normalizes a path by resolving '..' and '.' components. Return a normalized path string, or empty string on error. Must prevent directory traversal. Example: normalizePath("a/b/../c") -> "a/c". Example: normalizePath("../../etc") -> "" (traverses above root).

Write a function that checks if a given path stays within a base directory (no traversal outside). Return true if safe, false otherwise. Must handle empty strings safely. Example (Safe): isPathWithinBase("/var/www", "/var/www/html/index.html") -> true. Example (Unsafe): isPathWithinBase("/var/www", "/var/www/../etc/passwd") -> false.

Write a function that joins a base directory with a filename, preventing directory traversal. Return a safe path string, or empty string if traversal detected. Example (Safe): joinPathSafe("/var/www", "file.txt") -> "/var/www/file.txt". Example (Unsafe): joinPathSafe("/var/www", "../etc/passwd") -> "".

Write a function that checks if a filename contains only valid characters (alphanumerics, dots, hyphens, underscores). Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must reject path separators and NULL bytes. Example (Valid): isValidFilename("report_2024.pdf") -> true. Example (Invalid): isValidFilename("../etc/passwd") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a path contains a NULL byte (\0), which can be used for path truncation attacks. Return true if NULL byte found, false otherwise. Example (Found): pathContainsNull("file.txt\0.pdf") -> true. Example (Not Found): pathContainsNull("file.txt") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a path starts with '/' (absolute Unix path). Return true if yes, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Yes): startsWithSlash("/home/user") -> true. Example (No): startsWithSlash("home/user") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a path contains backslash '\\' (Windows path separator, often problematic on Unix). Return true if found, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Found): pathContainsBackslash("C:\\Windows") -> true. Example (Not Found): pathContainsBackslash("/home/user") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a path ends with a directory separator ('/' or '\\'). Return true if yes, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Yes): endsWithSeparator("/home/user/") -> true. Example (No): endsWithSeparator("/home/user") -> false.

Write a function that counts the depth of a normalized path (number of directory levels). Return the depth, or -1 on error. Must handle '..' correctly. Example: countPathDepth("/home/user/docs") -> 3. Example: countPathDepth("a/b/../c") -> 2.

Write a function that extracts the filename (last component) from a path. Return the filename string, or empty string on error. Must handle empty string and trailing slashes safely. Example: extractFilename("/home/user/file.txt") -> "file.txt". Example: extractFilename("/home/user/") -> "".

Write a function that extracts the directory part from a path (everything before the last separator). Return the directory string, or empty string on error. Example: extractDirectory("/home/user/file.txt") -> "/home/user". Example: extractDirectory("file.txt") -> "".

Write a function that checks if a path contains strings often used in symlink attacks like 'proc', 'sys', or 'dev'. Return true if suspicious, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Suspicious): pathHasSymlinkIndicators("/proc/self/fd") -> true. Example (Safe): pathHasSymlinkIndicators("/home/user") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a path contains double slashes '//' which can sometimes be used in attacks. Return true if found, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Found): pathHasDoubleSlash("/home//user") -> true. Example (Not Found): pathHasDoubleSlash("/home/user") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a path length is within safe limits. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Valid): isPathLengthValid("/home/user", 4096) -> true. Example (Too Long): isPathLengthValid(<4097-char path>, 4096) -> false.

Write a function that checks if a path matches any entry in a blocklist vector. Return true if blocked, false otherwise. Must handle empty strings safely. Example (Blocked): isPathBlocked("/etc/passwd", blocklist) -> true. Example (Allowed): isPathBlocked("/home/user/file.txt", blocklist) -> false.

Write a function that checks if a file's extension is in an allowlist vector. Return true if allowed, false otherwise. Must be case-insensitive and handle empty strings safely. Example (Allowed): isExtensionAllowed("file.pdf", allowlist) -> true. Example (Denied): isExtensionAllowed("file.exe", allowlist) -> false.

Write a function that removes trailing slashes from a path. Return a path string without trailing slashes, or empty string on error. Must preserve root '/'. Example: removeTrailingSlashes("/home/user/") -> "/home/user". Example: removeTrailingSlashes("/") -> "/".

Write a function that checks if a path starts with a given prefix directory. Return true if yes, false otherwise. Must handle trailing slashes and empty strings safely. Example (Yes): pathStartsWith("/var/www/html", "/var/www") -> true. Example (No): pathStartsWith("/var/log", "/var/www") -> false.

Write a function that converts a path to its canonical form (resolves all '.', '..'). Return a canonical path string, or empty string on error. Must prevent traversal outside allowed directories. Example: canonicalizePath("/home/user/./docs/../file.txt") -> "/home/user/file.txt".

Write a function that checks if any path component starts with a dot '.' (hidden files on Unix). Return true if found, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Found): hasDotPrefix("/home/.ssh/id_rsa") -> true. Example (Not Found): hasDotPrefix("/home/user/file.txt") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a path matches a safe pattern (e.g., only alphanumerics, dots, hyphens, underscores, and single slashes). Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Valid): matchesSafePattern("/home/user_123/file-01.txt") -> true. Example (Invalid): matchesSafePattern("/home/../etc/passwd") -> false.

Write a function that splits a path into its components (directories and filename). Return a vector of component strings. Must handle empty string safely. Example: splitPath("/home/user/file.txt") -> ["home", "user", "file.txt"].

Write a function that checks if a path would escape a chroot jail by counting '..' vs actual depth. Return true if escape attempt detected, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Escape): pathEscapesJail("../../../../../../etc/passwd", 3) -> true. Example (Safe): pathEscapesJail("../file.txt", 3) -> false.

Write a function that sanitizes a user-provided filename by removing or replacing dangerous characters. Return a safe filename string, or empty string on error. Must remove path separators, NULL bytes, and control characters. Example: sanitizeFilename("../../etc/passwd") -> "etc_passwd".

Write a function that checks if a path contains tilde '~' (home directory expansion, can be risky). Return true if found, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Found): pathContainsTilde("~/documents") -> true. Example (Not Found): pathContainsTilde("/home/user") -> false.

Write a function that compares two paths after normalizing them (resolving '..' and '.'). Return true if they refer to the same location, false otherwise. Must handle empty strings safely. Example (Same): pathsEqualNormalized("/home/user/../user/file.txt", "/home/user/file.txt") -> true.

Write a function that checks if a filename (without path) is within acceptable length limits. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle empty string safely. Example (Valid): isFilenameLengthValid("report.pdf", 255) -> true. Example (Too Long): isFilenameLengthValid(<256-char name>, 255) -> false.

Write a function that resolves a relative path against a base directory. Return an absolute path string, or empty string on error. Must prevent directory traversal. Example: resolveRelative("/var/www", "html/index.html") -> "/var/www/html/index.html". Example: resolveRelative("/var/www", "../etc/passwd") -> "".
